en: A personal letter from Thomas S. Gathright to Louis L. McInnis written from Henderson, Texas on December 31, 1879. Gathright discusses his current circumstances, including his wife's presence in Palestine and his expectation of a shipment, while requesting newspapers and inquiring about college prospects and events in Austin. The letter conveys Gathright's emotional distress and desire for correspondence with his friend.

body.value:
[Header] Henderson, Dec. 31. 1879. Dear Lewis,

Hugh and I are here
Mrs G. is in Palestine. We are waiting
for our plunder, but have heard
nothing from it. Mrs G. will come so
soon as it arrives.

Send me the two last Clarions, and
write me how you are doing and
what are the College prospects &c.
Write me what you heard in Austin
and all you know and feel.

I am the saddest mortal to night
living and if driven to let out and
write you a letter would give you
the horrors.

Your friend
Thos. S. Gathright

[Footer] To Prof. L. L. McInnis.
